title: Creates various programs to protect safety of truck drivers
summary: Relates to programs that promote and protect the safety of truck drivers in New York state.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         2359

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                   I N  S E N A T E

                                   January 19, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  Sens.  SEWARD, LARKIN -- read twice and ordered printed,
         and when printed to be committed to the Committee on Transportation

       AN ACT to amend the transportation law, the state finance law,  the  tax
         law  and  the  public  authorities  law,  in relation to programs that
         promote and protect the safety of truck drivers in New York state

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. This act shall be known and may be cited as "Jason's Law".
    2    S 2. Legislative intent. The legislature finds and declares that there
    3  is  a great need to provide truck drivers with safe places to rest while
    4  waiting for pending appointments or to  comply  with  federal  hours  of
    5  service  regulations.  Federal  law  requires motor carrier operators to
    6  rest for a period of ten hours  after  driving  for  eleven  consecutive
    7  hours.  Federal law further prohibits motor carrier operators from driv-
    8  ing more than sixty hours over a seven day  period.  These  requirements
    9  are  only  exacerbating  the  shortage  of  safe parking areas for motor
   10  carriers, forcing many drivers to park in  desolate,  poorly  lit  areas
   11  with  little  or  no security. Many shippers and receivers of freight do
   12  not allow truckers into their facilities until just before their  sched-
   13  uled  appointment time and insist that they leave promptly once delivery
   14  is complete. It is imperative that the legislature address  the  current
   15  shortage  of  long-term  parking for commercial motor vehicles to ensure
   16  the personal safety and  security  of  those  who  transport  goods  and
   17  provide essential services for the people of the state of New York.
   18    S  3.  The transportation law is amended by adding a new section 140-a
   19  to read as follows:
   20    S 140-A. MOTOR CARRIER SAFETY AND SECURITY REVOLVING LOAN PROGRAM.  1.
   21  THE COMMISSIONER SHALL ESTABLISH AND MAINTAIN A MOTOR CARRIER SAFETY AND
   22  SECURITY  REVOLVING LOAN PROGRAM TO PROVIDE LOANS TO ELIGIBLE APPLICANTS
   23  TO MAKE SAFETY  AND  SECURITY  UPGRADES  ON  THEIR  FACILITIES  FOR  THE
   24  PURPOSES DESIGNATED IN THIS SECTION. SUCH PROGRAM SHALL PROVIDE INTEREST

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD05848-01-1

       S. 2359                             2

    1  FREE  LOANS TO ELIGIBLE APPLICANTS FOR SUCH SAFETY AND SECURITY IMPROVE-
    2  MENT PROJECTS AS THE COMMISSIONER SHALL DEEM TO BE ELIGIBLE PURSUANT  TO
    3  THIS SECTION.
    4    2.  STATE  FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE IN THE FORM OF A LOAN MAY BE PROVIDED,
    5  SUBJECT TO APPROPRIATION BY THE LEGISLATURE, TO RECIPIENTS FOR  ELIGIBLE
    6  PROJECTS  AS  DEFINED  IN THIS SECTION. ANY FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE AWARDED
    7  SHALL BE PROVIDED FROM THE MOTOR CARRIER SAFETY AND  SECURITY  REVOLVING
    8  LOAN  FUND  ESTABLISHED  PURSUANT  TO SECTION NINETY-NINE-T OF THE STATE
    9  FINANCE LAW.
   10    3. ELIGIBLE APPLICANTS SHALL MEAN OWNERS AND OPERATORS OF PRIVATE REST
   11  AREAS, TRUCK STOPS, TRAVEL PLAZAS, AND ANY OTHER FACILITY WHICH PROVIDES
   12  MOTOR CARRIERS WITH A SAFE PLACE TO REST  WHILE  WAITING  FOR  SCHEDULED
   13  APPOINTMENTS AND/OR COMPLYING WITH FEDERAL HOURS OF SERVICE REGULATIONS.
   14    4.  ELIGIBLE PROJECTS SHALL INCLUDE: (A) THE PURCHASE AND INSTALLATION
   15  OF NEW SECURITY SYSTEMS, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO ALARMS  AND  VIDEO
   16  SURVEILLANCE  EQUIPMENT;  (B)  THE  PURCHASE  AND INSTALLATION OF NEW OR
   17  IMPROVED LIGHTING EQUIPMENT TO PROVIDE ENHANCED  VISIBILITY  IN  PARKING
   18  AREAS;  (C) HIRING OR OTHERWISE MAINTAINING SECURITY GUARDS THAT PROVIDE
   19  REGULAR PATROLS OF THE ENTIRE FACILITY;  (D)  THE  CONSTRUCTION  OF  NEW
   20  PARKING  FACILITIES;  AND  (E)  UPGRADING AND IMPROVING EXISTING PARKING
   21  FACILITIES.
   22    5. THE COMMISSIONER SHALL PROMULGATE RULES  AND  REGULATIONS  FOR  THE
   23  PURPOSE OF CARRYING OUT THE PROVISIONS OF THIS SECTION, INCLUDING ESTAB-
   24  LISHING:  (A)  AN  APPLICATION  PROCESS  WHEREBY ELIGIBLE APPLICANTS MAY
   25  APPLY FOR LOANS; (B) CRITERIA AND STANDARDS FOR  DETERMINING  AN  APPLI-
   26  CANT'S  ELIGIBILITY FOR A LOAN; (C) CRITERIA AND STANDARDS TO BE USED IN
   27  DETERMINING THE AMOUNT OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO BE  PROVIDED  TO  EACH
   28  APPLICANT;  AND (D) CRITERIA AND STANDARDS TO BE USED IN DETERMINING THE
   29  LOAN REPAYMENT PERIODS AND THE TERMS OF REPAYMENT AGREEMENTS.
   30    6. NOTHING IN THIS SECTION SHALL BE CONSTRUED  TO  PREVENT  APPLICANTS
   31  WHO  HAVE  RECEIVED  TAX  CREDITS PURSUANT TO SUBDIVISION FORTY-THREE OF
   32  SECTION TWO HUNDRED TEN OF THE TAX LAW FROM PARTICIPATING IN  THE  MOTOR
   33  CARRIER  SAFETY  AND  SECURITY REVOLVING LOAN PROGRAM OFFERED UNDER THIS
   34  SECTION.
   35    S 4. The state finance law is amended by adding a new section 99-t  to
   36  read as follows:
   37    S  99-T.  MOTOR  CARRIER  SAFETY  AND SECURITY REVOLVING LOAN FUND. 1.
   38  THERE IS HEREBY ESTABLISHED IN THE JOINT  CUSTODY  OF  THE  STATE  COMP-
   39  TROLLER  AND  THE COMMISSIONER OF TAXATION AND FINANCE A SPECIAL FUND TO
   40  BE KNOWN AS THE MOTOR CARRIER SAFETY AND SECURITY REVOLVING LOAN FUND.
   41    2. SUCH FUND SHALL CONSIST OF ALL MONIES APPROPRIATED FOR ITS PURPOSE,
   42  ALL MONIES TRANSFERRED TO SUCH FUND  PURSUANT  TO  LAW  AND  ALL  MONIES
   43  REQUIRED  TO BE PAID INTO OR CREDITED TO THIS FUND, INCLUDING ALL MONIES
   44  RECEIVED BY THE FUND OR DONATED TO IT, AND PAYMENT OF PRINCIPAL ON LOANS
   45  MADE FROM THE FUND.
   46    3. MONIES OF THE FUND, WHEN ALLOCATED, SHALL BE MADE AVAILABLE TO  THE
   47  COMMISSIONER  OF TRANSPORTATION TO PROVIDE LOANS PURSUANT TO SECTION ONE
   48  HUNDRED FORTY-A OF THE TRANSPORTATION LAW.
   49    S 5. Section 210 of the tax law is amended by adding two new  subdivi-
   50  sions 43 and 44 to read as follows:
   51    43.  CREDIT  FOR  PROVIDING A SAFE HARBOR FOR MOTOR CARRIERS.  (A) FOR
   52  TAXABLE YEARS BEGINNING ON OR AFTER JANUARY FIRST, TWO THOUSAND  TWELVE,
   53  A  QUALIFYING  TAXPAYER  SHALL  BE  ALLOWED A CREDIT AGAINST ANY TAX DUE
   54  UNDER THIS ARTICLE IN AN AMOUNT OF TWENTY PERCENT.
   55    (B) (1) FOR THE PURPOSES OF THIS SUBDIVISION, A "QUALIFYING  TAXPAYER"
   56  ALLOWED  A  CREDIT  SHALL MEAN A TAXPAYER ENGAGED IN THE SHIPPING AND/OR

       S. 2359                             3

    1  RECEIVING OF ANY COMMODITIES VIA A  MOTOR  CARRIER,  OR  AN  INDIVIDUAL,
    2  EITHER  OF  WHICH  PROVIDES  QUALIFYING MOTOR CARRIERS SERVICES AT THEIR
    3  FACILITIES THAT PROVIDE A SECURE AREA IN WHICH SUCH MOTOR  CARRIERS  MAY
    4  WAIT FOR PENDING APPOINTMENTS OR TO COMPLY WITH FEDERAL HOURS OF SERVICE
    5  REGULATIONS.
    6    (2) FOR THE PURPOSES OF THIS SUBDIVISION, A "QUALIFYING MOTOR CARRIER"
    7  SHALL  MEAN  A  MOTOR  CARRIER THAT IS NOT EMPLOYED BY THE TAXPAYER OR A
    8  COMPANY OR CORPORATION THAT IS AFFILIATED WITH THE TAXPAYER.
    9    (C) QUALIFYING TAXPAYERS WHO APPLY FOR AND  RECEIVE  SUCH  CREDIT  FOR
   10  PROVIDING  SAFE HARBOR FOR MOTOR CARRIERS SHALL NOT BE LIABLE FOR INJURY
   11  OR DEATH TO ANY PERSON OR FOR ANY PROPERTY DAMAGE OCCURRING ON OR AT THE
   12  FACILITY PROVIDED, HOWEVER, THAT SUCH TAXPAYER SHALL  NOT  BE  PROTECTED
   13  FROM  LIABILITY CAUSED BY THE INTENTIONAL, WILLFUL, AND RECKLESS MISCON-
   14  DUCT OF SUCH TAXPAYER.
   15    44. CREDIT FOR SECURITY UPGRADES  AND  PARKING  IMPROVEMENTS  AT  REST
   16  AREAS.  (A)  FOR  TAXABLE YEARS BEGINNING ON OR AFTER JANUARY FIRST, TWO
   17  THOUSAND TWELVE, A QUALIFYING TAXPAYER SHALL BE ALLOWED A CREDIT AGAINST
   18  ANY TAX DUE UNDER THIS ARTICLE IN AN AMOUNT EQUAL TO  FIFTY  PERCENT  OF
   19  THE TOTAL EXPENDITURES FOR THE PURCHASE, INSTALLATION AND/OR MAINTENANCE
   20  OF  A  QUALIFYING  PROJECT  OR PROJECTS THAT ARE INTENDED TO IMPROVE THE
   21  SAFETY AND SECURITY OF FACILITIES OPERATED BY QUALIFYING TAXPAYERS.
   22    (B) FOR THE PURPOSES OF THIS SUBDIVISION A "QUALIFYING TAXPAYER" SHALL
   23  MEAN OWNERS AND OPERATORS OF PRIVATE REST  AREAS,  TRUCK  STOPS,  TRAVEL
   24  PLAZAS  AND ANY OTHER FACILITY WHICH PROVIDES MOTOR CARRIERS WITH A SAFE
   25  PLACE TO REST WHILE WAITING FOR SCHEDULED APPOINTMENTS AND/OR  COMPLYING
   26  WITH FEDERAL HOURS OF SERVICE REGULATIONS.
   27    (C)  FOR PURPOSES OF THIS SUBDIVISION, A "QUALIFYING PROJECT" INCLUDES
   28  THE FOLLOWING:
   29    (1) THE PURCHASE AND INSTALLATION OF NEW SECURITY  SYSTEMS,  INCLUDING
   30  BUT NOT LIMITED TO ALARMS AND VIDEO SURVEILLANCE EQUIPMENT;
   31    (2)  THE  PURCHASE AND INSTALLATION OF NEW OR IMPROVED LIGHTING EQUIP-
   32  MENT TO PROVIDE ENHANCED VISIBILITY IN PARKING AREAS;
   33    (3) HIRING OR OTHERWISE MAINTAINING SECURITY GUARDS THAT PROVIDE REGU-
   34  LAR PATROLS OF THE ENTIRE FACILITY;
   35    (4) THE CONSTRUCTION OF NEW PARKING FACILITIES; AND
   36    (5) UPGRADING AND IMPROVING EXISTING PARKING FACILITIES.
   37    (D) NOTHING IN THIS SUBDIVISION SHALL BE CONSTRUED TO PREVENT  TAXPAY-
   38  ERS WHO HAVE RECEIVED FUNDING THROUGH THE MOTOR CARRIER SAFETY AND SECU-
   39  RITY  REVOLVING  LOAN  PROGRAM  FROM  BEING  ELIGIBLE FOR THE TAX CREDIT
   40  OFFERED IN THIS SECTION.
   41    S 6. The public authorities law is amended by adding a new section 388
   42  to read as follows:
   43    S 388. "BULL PEN" DEMONSTRATION PROGRAM.  1.  THE  COMMISSIONER  SHALL
   44  INITIATE  A  PROGRAM  FOR THE ESTABLISHMENT OF ADDITIONAL REST AREAS FOR
   45  COMMERCIAL TRUCK DRIVERS ALONG THE NEW YORK STATE THRUWAY.
   46    2. IN PURSUING THE DEVELOPMENT OF  SUCH  FACILITIES  THE  COMMISSIONER
   47  SHALL WORK IN CONSULTATION WITH REPRESENTATIVES OF THE NEW YORK TRUCKING
   48  INDUSTRY  TO  ASSESS POTENTIAL SITE OPTIONS WITH AN EMPHASIS ON ADAPTIVE
   49  REUSE AND/OR MODIFICATION OF EXISTING INFRASTRUCTURE AND CAPITAL FACILI-
   50  TIES TO MAXIMIZE THE AVAILABILITY OF REST AREA SERVICES IN THE MOST COST
   51  EFFECTIVE MANNER POSSIBLE.
   52    3. IN  CONCERT  WITH  THE  AFOREMENTIONED  INVENTORYING  AND  PLANNING
   53  EFFORTS,  THE COMMISSIONER SHALL INITIATE A DEMONSTRATION BULL PEN PILOT
   54  PROJECT WHICH SHALL TEST THE AFFORDABILITY AND EFFECTIVENESS OF DEVELOP-
   55  ING DEDICATED PARKING FACILITIES AS A LOW COST OPTION FOR OFFERING  SAFE
   56  HARBOR  FOR  TRUCK  DRIVERS IN NEW YORK STATE.  SUCH FACILITIES SHALL BE

       S. 2359                             4

    1  EQUIPPED WITH FENCING, SECURITY CAMERAS, GATED ENTRANCES, ELECTRIC HOOK-
    2  UPS FOR POWERING APPLIANCES AND EQUIPMENT IN INDIVIDUAL TRUCK CABINS AND
    3  TRUCK DRIVER SLEEPER QUARTERS AND LIMITED  LAVATORY  ACCOMMODATIONS.  IN
    4  PURSUING  SUCH FACILITIES, THE COMMISSIONER SHALL CONSIDER THE POTENTIAL
    5  FOR UTILIZING E-ZPASS TECHNOLOGY AS A MEANS FOR ENHANCING PUBLIC  SAFETY
    6  AND SECURITY.
    7    S 7. This act shall take effect immediately.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the transportation law, the state finance law, the tax law and the public authorities law, in relation to programs that promote and protect the safety of truck drivers in New York state
